meanings.definition: The process of growing old or aging.
meanings.sent1: The senescences of the tree were evident in its gnarled trunk and sparse leaves.
meanings.sent2: As the years passed, the senescences of the old dog became more noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The senescences of the antique clock made it tick slower and slower each day.
meanings.sent4: The senescences of the building were like wrinkles on its weathered facade.
meanings.sent5: She studied the senescences of the ancient ruins, marveling at the passage of time.

meanings.definition: The condition or process of deterioration with age.
meanings.sent1: The senescences of the car were evident in its rusted body and worn-out tires.
meanings.sent2: With each passing year, the senescences of the bridge became more pronounced.
meanings.sent3: The senescences of the forgotten toy were revealed as its colors faded away.
meanings.sent4: The senescences of the once vibrant painting now showed cracks and discoloration.
meanings.sent5: He witnessed the senescences of the neglected garden, where flowers wilted and weeds took over.
